snippet: The remains of what had been Hurricane Isaac blew toward the Midwest, causing some flash floods and leaving thousands without power.
abstract: Remnants of what had been Hurricane Isaac blow toward the parched Midwest, dumping more than a foot of rain, causing isolated flash floods and leaving thousands of people without power.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY and BRET SCHULTE
byline.contributor: Jack Healy reported from St. Louis, and Bret Schulte from Fayetteville, Ark. Campbell Robertson contributed reporting from Plaquemines Parish, La.

lead_paragraph: The remains of what had been Hurricane Isaac blew toward the Midwest, causing some flash floods and leaving thousands without power.

headline.seo: Flash Floods as Isaac Heads for the Midwest
headline.main: Last of Storm Attacks Midwest Drought
headline.print_headline: Last of Storm Attacks Midwest Drought
